title: ArcGIS Location Services Meta-Package
code: library(arcgis) #> Attaching core arcgis packages: #>   - {arcgisutils} v0.1.0 #>   - {arcgislayers} v0.1.0  health_rankings_url <- "https://services.arcgis.com/P3ePLMYs2RVChkJx/arcgis/rest/services/2022_County_Health_Rankings/FeatureServer"  arc_open(health_rankings_url) #> <FeatureServer <3 layers, 0 tables>> #> CRS: 4326 #> Capabilities: Query,Extract #>   0: Country (esriGeometryPolygon) #>   1: State (esriGeometryPolygon) #>   2: County (esriGeometryPolygon)

title: Implementation
text: arcgislayers open source package part Environmental Systems Research Institute’s (Esri) R-ArcGIS Bridge project. arcgislayers enables developers interact ArcGIS data services directly R. arcgislayers, users can read, write, administer remotely hosted data directly R using native objects.

title: Implementation
text: evolving landscape geospatial analysis, critical shift towards cloud-native infrastructure emerged, characterized exposure data via REST APIs. Esri’s ArcGIS Location Services characterized ArcGIS Platform embody transition. Location services accessible via REST API endpoints language agnostic. existing solutions like arcgisbinding enable reading writing ArcGIS hosted data, present limitations (Aydin et al.). Notably, arcgisbinding relies ArcGIS Pro license confined Windows operating system, support additional administration hosted data services. Moreover, community-driven endeavors esri2sf, arcpullr, among others, strive bridge gap (CITE). However, efforts fall short delivering comprehensive, officially supported, high-performance alternatives. arcgislayers official, Esri-backed, open-source R package designed interact ArcGIS Image Servers Feature Services. Leveraging REST services offered ArcGIS, arcgislayers empowers developers seamlessly administer, read, write data without constraints proprietary licenses operating systems.

title: Implementation
text: arcgislayers supports Image Servers Feature Services. reading raster imagery, arcgislayers returns objects class SpatRaster terra package. arcgislayers’ vector capabilities much sophisticated, however. r-spatial ecosystem, sf objects de facto representation geometric objects associated attributes. , arcgislayers utilizes sf objects data.frames represent spatial -spatial data respectively. Due ubiquity sf objects additional geometry types supported directly can via wk (edzer, probably bivand somewhere inhere dunnington). ArcGIS REST API defines number JSON objects understood endpoints. Notably, REST APIs definitions geometries objects. Underpinning arcgislayers R package arcgisutils used serializing data.frame sf objects Esri JSON formats. arcgisutils also provides utilities deserializing Esri JSON returned REST APIs sf data.frame objects. de/serialization provided arcgisutils enables seamless reading writing geospatial data ArcGIS Location Services.

title: Implementation
text: Notes Aydin et al introduce arcgisbinding provides binding ArcGIS pro enabling reading writing ArcGIS Proprietary data formats fly geospatial transformations using transformation engine ’re seeing shift towards cloud-native geospatial analysisdata infrastructure exposed via rest apis Esri provides useful technology via ArcGIS Location Services. Location services exposed via rest APIs well documented. Endpoints can public private depending hosting solution authentication used. REST services provide language agnostic interface proprietary code allowing development completely open source bindings services arcgisbinding provides way users R ArcGIS Pro read image feature services fairly limited. Noteably, use arcgisbinding requires ArcGIS Pro license requires window machine. , arcgisbinding provide capabilities hosted data management. arcgislayers builds upon REST service provided ArcGIS. arcgislayers open source R package interacting ArcGIS image servers Feature services. number community driven efforts address gap notably esri2sf, arcpullr, among others. arcgislayers official, esri supported, highly performant alternative packages
code: library(arcgislayers)  url <- "https://services3.arcgis.com/ZvidGQkLaDJxRSJ2/arcgis/rest/services/PLACES_LocalData_for_BetterHealth/FeatureServer/0"  flayer <- arc_open(url) flayer <FeatureLayer <28484 features, 154 fields>> Name: PlacePoints Geometry Type: esriGeometryPoint CRS: 3785 Capabilities: Query,Extract

what: arcgis: ArcGIS Location Services Meta-Package — arcgis-package
title: arcgis: ArcGIS Location Services Meta-Package — arcgis-package
text: Provides easy installation loading core ArcGIS location services packages 'arcgislayers', 'arcgisutils', 'arcgisgeocode', 'arcgisplaces'. Enabling developers interact spatial data services 'ArcGIS Online', 'ArcGIS Enterprise', 'ArcGIS Platform'. Learn 'arcgis' meta-package https://developers.arcgis.com/r-bridge/.
